ActorTalk: The fireworks, and this whole experience... are coming to a close.
Let's think about all that during our walk, Commandant.
Look, Commandant. There's a carving on this stone wall... is that a clover?
Maybe it's something else. Maybe we carved it together in a past loop.
You remember the recent loops, but... what if we've gone through even more of them before this?
We think this is only the third time, but maybe that's just because all the others were erased.
This time, you're the one who remembers. But next time, it could be me... or maybe neither of us will remember anything at all.
The one who keeps their memories might just be an unexpected variable. And this clover... it could be another variable, one among many.
Look, [PlayerName].
These footprints, for example—right now, we hope they'll stay behind, and guide us the next time around.
But if we see them again, will we still feel the same?
We might think they're just ordinary footprints. Or maybe just another sign that we're caught in a loop.
And we might not even be able to tell if they're guiding us forward, or just reminding us we're stuck. If that's the case...
Because... I couldn't bear it if you're the one who keeps seeing them over and over.
If we can't break the loop this time, and you're the only one who remembers each time after...
[PlayerName], I don't want these so-called shackles to hurt you. And I don't want to lose my way if my memories fade again.
If that happens, I won't be able to help you at all.
What if I'm the one who forgets again and again... and you're the one who remembers, carrying it all alone each time?
Then I'll find you, every single time. As long as I'm with you, that's enough to keep me going.
In that, I think we feel exactly the same.
As long as the person beside us stays the same, the feelings we share will leave a lasting mark.
Even if our memories fade, we'll never lose our way.
I understand now, Commandant. It's time for us to move on to the next place.
About the loop, the wish, and what comes next...
Hmm, another little surprise from the Dreamweaver?
That would make things complicated.
Why these gloomy thoughts all of a sudden?
But what if it's the other way around?
So even if those memories become shackles—
We won't have to fear the pain they carry, right?
